threat: If a user were tricked into opening a file with Emacs, a local attacker could execute arbitrary Lisp code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.
If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted file with Emacs, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary Lisp code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to restart Emacs to make all the
necessary changes.
